group_1.narration: ―Mikage―@We flew around so much and gathered@a ton of ornaments, but...
―Nayuta―@We don't have much to go on other than@that the girl is named "Rei-chan"...
―Nayuta―@...To turn the page somewhat,@I have a question for you all.
―Mikage―@Hm?
―Yozuru―@What is it?
―Nayuta―@When listening to the voice of the family@contained within the ornaments...
―Nayuta―@I feel as though I've heard@this Rei-chan's voice before.
―Nayuta―@Have any of you?
―Mikage―@Hmm...no, I've never heard it.
―Yozuru―@...I can't remember where exactly I heard it,@but it does sound familiar to me.
―Mikage―@Huh...?
―Sudachi―@Fumunmu!
―Mikage―@You, too, Sutan?!
―Nayuta―@...So it's someone that Yozuru,@Sudachi, and I know...
―Nayuta―@But also someone that Mikage possibly@doesn't know...
―Mikage―@...Do you know someone like that?
―Nayuta―@No one comes to mind...
―Yozuru―@If it were someone that all four of us knew,@we could come up with something.
―Mikage―@But I've never heard that voice.
―Nayuta―@Are you absolutely certain you haven't? There's no chance@it was just a voice that didn't stick with you?
―Mikage―@No, 'cause when I hear this girl's voice,@it gives me the creeps!
―Mikage―@I've never felt this way about@someone's voice before.
―Mikage―@If I did,@I'd never be able to forget it.
―Nayuta―@I see...

group_1.textLeft: Here we are.

group_1.narration: "It looks like this store will be closing up@shop at the end of the year."
"Aw man...what a shame."
"So, about this Christmas..."
"Oh yeah, sorry...but I'm spending it@with my boyfriend this year.@I appreciate you asking, though."

group_1.textRight: That made me think - Rei-chan's gradually@growing up in these, huh?

group_1.textLeft: It seems that way. Her voice is growing@more mature.

group_1.textRight: Yeah, it's giving me less of the willies now!
And now I feel like I've heard it before,@too, just like you!
I know Rei-chan's voice!

group_1.textLeft: ...I-is that so?
(...But...in my case...as Rei-chan's@voice develops...)
(It becomes less familiar to me,@contrary to Mikage.)

group_1.textRight: The owner of the voice has grown up...@This is a significant development.

group_1.textLeft: ...How so?

group_1.textRight: It means she is an adult.
Throughout these ornaments we trace, there has@been a long passage of time over the span of years.

group_1.textLeft: Oh yes, that's right!
In other words, the conversation that@we are chasing is not about the present day,
but the past!

group_1.textRight: Yes, it seems so.

group_1.textLeft: So now that we know that,@what should we do?
...We continue to follow the ornaments.
We'll wait until they reveal their@personal information!

group_1.textRight: You haven't changed the plan at all!
Indeed...

group_1.textLeft: A-anyway, let us be on our way@to the next ornament...

group_1.textRight: Oh, wait!
I wanna stop by your house one time@while we're in this world, Nayutan!
I can't carry anymore ornaments,@so I wanna borrow your bag.
She's right; neither Sudachi nor@I can carry any more, either.

group_1.textLeft: And we don't know how many left@we still have to chase...
Yes, I think it's best we fetch a bag.
And I'd like to do a spot of research@as well...

group_1.textRight: What're you looking into?

group_1.textLeft: Once, when I was distributing a notice@from the neighborhood association,
I glanced at the nameplate of the house next to@mine, which had the neighbors' names written on it,
and one of them used the kanji for "zero."

group_1.textRight: Zero...so that would be "Rei"...@[chara:113702:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:113702:motion_400][chara:113702:lipSynch_1]like Rei-chan?!
That must be it.
It's possible for packages to be@misdelivered between neighbors,
and if there's someone in that house@who might be called Rei-chan,
it would be my first guess for@the correct delivery address.

group_1.textLeft: You understand!
Our next stop, then, shall be@the homes of Miss Rei-chan and I!

group_1.textRight: Fumuuuu!
